abstract.t: This memo documents a proposal for exchanging EPP (ExtensibleProvisioning Protocol) messages as XML documents between a client anda server via SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol), using the SOAPrequest/response communication model. An EPP message is encapsulatedin the SOAP Body, while the EPP session information is encoded in theSOAP header, enabling EPP session-oriented messaging over the SOAPprotocol. It is designed to work on top of any transport bindingsdefined for SOAP, taking advantage of the variety of SOAP softwaretools and environments available for web services.
